item.title: Words Hold Worlds
item.description: Part I: Words Hold Worlds on etymology and the deep weird of language “In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was a mistake.” —Eliza Morgenstern, Linguistic Aporias (1978). (1) I. The Lie of Meaning Language is powerful. It builds worlds, undoes them, and loops meaning through cultural, historical, and neural circuitry. This is an anatomy of that power. Trace a word and you’ll find its origin was something completely different.
